title: Ottawa COPD Risk Scale
description: Predicts 30-day mortality or serious adverse events (MI, intubation, etc) in emergency department COPD patients. Uses 10 clinical variables to stratify risk from low (2.2%) to very high (75.6%).

parameters.name: peripheral_vascular_intervention
parameters.description: History of intervention for peripheral vascular disease

parameters.name: intubation_respiratory_distress
parameters.description: History of intubation for respiratory distress

parameters.name: heart_rate_110_or_higher
parameters.description: Heart rate ≥110 beats per minute on ED arrival

parameters.name: too_ill_for_walk_test
parameters.description: Too ill to do walk test after ED treatment

parameters.name: acute_ischemic_changes_ecg
parameters.description: Acute ischemic changes on ECG (clinician interpretation)

parameters.name: pulmonary_congestion_xray
parameters.description: Pulmonary congestion on chest x-ray (clinician interpretation)

result.name: ottawa_copd_score
result.description: Total Ottawa COPD Risk Scale score

ranges.interpretation: This patient has a low risk (2.2%) of serious adverse events within 30 days. Serious adverse events include death, admission to monitored unit, intubation, noninvasive ventilation, myocardial infarction, or relapse requiring hospital admission within 14 days.

This patient has a medium risk (4.0-7.2%) of serious adverse events within 30 days. Consider closer monitoring and follow-up arrangements. Serious adverse events include death, admission to monitored unit, intubation, noninvasive ventilation, myocardial infarction, or relapse requiring hospital admission within 14 days.

This patient has a high risk (12.5-20.9%) of serious adverse events within 30 days. Strong consideration should be given to admission or intensive outpatient monitoring. Serious adverse events include death, admission to monitored unit, intubation, noninvasive ventilation, myocardial infarction, or relapse requiring hospital admission within 14 days.

This patient has a very high risk (32.9-75.6%) of serious adverse events within 30 days. Admission is strongly recommended with close monitoring and aggressive treatment. Serious adverse events include death, admission to monitored unit, intubation, noninvasive ventilation, myocardial infarction, or relapse requiring hospital admission within 14 days.

This patient has an extremely high risk (>75%) of serious adverse events within 30 days. Immediate admission with intensive monitoring is indicated. Note: Scores of 9-10 were not well studied in the original derivation and validation cohorts.

references: Stiell IG, Clement CM, Aaron SD, Rowe BH, Perry JJ, Brison RJ, et al. Clinical characteristics associated with adverse events in patients with exacerbation of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease: a prospective cohort study. CMAJ. 2014 Oct 7;186(15):E563-73. doi: 10.1503/cmaj.140677.

Stiell IG, Perry JJ, Clement CM, Brison RJ, Rowe BH, Aaron SD, et al. Clinical validation of a risk scale for serious outcomes among patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease managed in the emergency department. CMAJ. 2018 Oct 15;190(41):E1202-E1211. doi: 10.1503/cmaj.180232.
formula: OCRS = (CABG × 1) + (PVD intervention × 1) + (Intubation history × 2) + (HR ≥110 × 2) + (Too ill for walk test × 2) + (Acute ischemic ECG × 2) + (Pulmonary congestion × 1) + (Hgb <10 × 3) + (Urea ≥12 × 1) + (CO2 ≥35 × 1)
notes: Designed for ED patients with COPD exacerbation
Score of 0 has 2.2% risk of serious adverse events
Score of 1-2 is considered cutoff for low vs medium risk
Allows for clinician judgment in ECG and chest x-ray interpretation
Serious adverse events: death, monitored unit admission, intubation, MI, major procedure, or ED return with admission within 14 days
Scores 9-10 not well studied in original research
Should be used in conjunction with clinical judgment
May help guide disposition decisions and follow-up planning
